2.1.3 Question 3

cars_data = cars
Y = cars_data$dist
X = cbind(1, cars$speed)
transpose = t(X)
beta = ((solve(transpose %*% X)%*%transpose) %*% Y)
beta

           [,1]
[1,] -17.579095
[2,]   3.932409




2.1.4 Question 4

lr = lm(dist ~ speed, data = cars)
summary(lr)

title: 3  Prac3
text:
3.1.1 Question 4

x = seq(-2,2, by = 0.1)
plot(x, sin(x), type = "l")










3.1.2 Question 5

library(car)
#attempt
t_dist_set = sort(rt(1000,1))
theoretical_pop = sort(rnorm(1000000))
quantiles = theoretical_pop[seq(1,1000000, length.out = 1000)] 
envelope_matrix = matrix(NA, nrow = 1000, ncol = 1000)
# replicate fn
for(i in 1:1000){
  
  envelope_matrix[i, ] = sort(rnorm(1000))
}

lower_bound = apply(envelope_matrix, 2, quantile, probs = 0.025)
upper_bound =  apply(envelope_matrix, 2, quantile, probs = 0.975)

plot(quantiles, t_dist_set, ylim = c(-5, 5), xlim = c(-3, 3))
abline(a = 0, b = 1, col = "blue")
lines(quantiles, lower_bound, col = "blue", lty = 2)
lines(quantiles, upper_bound, col = "blue", lty = 2)







qqPlot(t_dist_set, envelope = 0.95, ylim = c(-5, 5))








[1] 1000    1

title: 4  Prac4
text:
4.1.1 TidyVerse (Question 1-6)

library(tidyverse)
library(nycflights13)
library(dplyr)

#Question 1
flights

# A tibble: 336,776 × 19
    year month   day dep_time sched_dep_time dep_delay arr_time sched_arr_time
   <int> <int> <int>    <int>          <int>     <dbl>    <int>          <int>
 1  2013     1     1      517            515         2      830            819
 2  2013     1     1      533            529         4      850            830
 3  2013     1     1      542            540         2      923            850
 4  2013     1     1      544            545        -1     1004           1022
 5  2013     1     1      554            600        -6      812            837
 6  2013     1     1      554            558        -4      740            728
 7  2013     1     1      555            600        -5      913            854
 8  2013     1     1      557            600        -3      709            723
 9  2013     1     1      557            600        -3      838            846
10  2013     1     1      558            600        -2      753            745
# ℹ 336,766 more rows
# ℹ 11 more variables: arr_delay <dbl>, carrier <chr>, flight <int>,
#   tailnum <chr>, origin <chr>, dest <chr>, air_time <dbl>, distance <dbl>,
#   hour <dbl>, minute <dbl>, time_hour <dttm>

#Question 2
ans = flights %>% 
  filter(month == 1) %>% # find specific row
  group_by(carrier) %>% 
  summarise(carrier_dist_vec_mean = mean(distance), 
            carrier_dist_vec_sd = sd(distance)) %>% 
  arrange(carrier_dist_vec_mean) # order by = arrange
ans

# A tibble: 16 × 3
   carrier carrier_dist_vec_mean carrier_dist_vec_sd
   <chr>                   <dbl>               <dbl>
 1 YV                       229                  0  
 2 9E                       476.               334. 
 3 EV                       522.               294. 
 4 US                       536.               553.

 6 FL                       691.               142.

10 DL                      1220.               644. 
11 AA                      1350.               626. 
12 UA                      1462.               778. 
13 F9                      1620                  0  
14 AS                      2402                  0  
15 VX                      2495.                98.2
16 HA                      4983                  0  

#Question 3
# You cannot have the sd of 1 value and in month 1 OO only has 1 occurance
flights %>% 
  filter(month == 1) %>% 
  filter(carrier == "OO")

# A tibble: 1 × 19
   year month   day dep_time sched_dep_time dep_delay arr_time sched_arr_time
  <int> <int> <int>    <int>          <int>     <dbl>    <int>          <int>
1  2013     1    30     1222           1115        67     1402           1215

#   hour <dbl>, minute <dbl>, time_hour <dttm>

# The 0s arise from all the sd of YV, F9, AS, HA all have multiple identical data points
flights %>% 
  filter(month == 1, carrier == "YV") %>% 
  select(distance)

flights %>% 
  group_by(carrier, month) %>%

12    12 19.8  11.7  18.0   17.0  10.8  27.9  13.1  26.1  -3.14 12.7  NA   
# ℹ 5 more variables: UA <dbl>, US <dbl>, VX <dbl>, WN <dbl>, YV <dbl>

# Question 5
count = flights %>% 
  filter(!is.na(dep_delay), !is.na(arr_delay)) %>% 
  summarise(nTot = n())

prop = flights %>% 
  filter(dep_delay > 0, arr_delay <= 0, !is.na(dep_delay), !is.na(arr_delay)) %>% 
  summarise(nSat = n())

ans = prop$nSat / count$nTot
ans

[1] 0.1082708

# One liner
ans <- flights %>%
  filter(!is.na(dep_delay), !is.na(arr_delay)) %>%
  summarise(proportion = mean(dep_delay > 0 & arr_delay <= 0, na.rm = TRUE))
ans

# A tibble: 1 × 1
  proportion
       <dbl>
1      0.108

# This one liner create a true false vector and then 
# just sum up the trues and divide by total

#Question 6
Q1 = flights %>% 
  distinct(origin, dest, carrier) %>% 
  count(origin, dest, name = "numCarrier") %>% 
  filter(numCarrier > 1)
Q1

# A tibble: 128 × 3
   origin dest  numCarrier
   <chr>  <chr>      <int>
 1 EWR    ATL            4
 2 EWR    AUS            2
 3 EWR    BDL            2
 4 EWR    BNA            2
 5 EWR    BOS            3
 6 EWR    BWI            2
 7 EWR    CHS            2
 8 EWR    CLE            2
 9 EWR    CLT            3
10 EWR    CVG            2
# ℹ 118 more rows

avg = flights %>% 
  group_by(origin, dest, carrier) %>% 
  summarise(avg_arr_delay = mean(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE))

Q2 = avg %>% 
  group_by(origin, dest) %>% 
  filter(n() > 1) %>%
  left_join(airlines, by = "carrier")
Q2

# A tibble: 343 × 5
# Groups:   origin, dest [128]
   origin dest  carrier avg_arr_delay name                    
   <chr>  <chr> <chr>           <dbl> <chr>                   
 1 EWR    ATL   9E              -6.25 Endeavor Air Inc.       
 2 EWR    ATL   DL              10.0  Delta Air Lines Inc.    
 3 EWR    ATL   EV              19.5  ExpressJet Airlines Inc.
 4 EWR    ATL   UA              10.5  United Air Lines Inc.   
 5 EWR    AUS   UA               4.28 United Air Lines Inc.   
 6 EWR    AUS   WN             -11.2  Southwest Airlines Co.  
 7 EWR    BDL   EV               6.78 ExpressJet Airlines Inc.
 8 EWR    BDL   UA              22.6  United Air Lines Inc.   
 9 EWR    BNA   EV              17.7  ExpressJet Airlines Inc.
10 EWR    BNA   WN              -2.13 Southwest Airlines Co.  
# ℹ 333 more rows

Q3 = Q2 %>%
  group_by(origin, dest) %>% 
  summarise(worst_arrival = max(avg_arr_delay),
            worst_airline = name[which.max(avg_arr_delay)],
            best_arrival = min(avg_arr_delay), 
            best_airline = name[which.min(avg_arr_delay)]) %>% 
  ungroup()
Q3

# A tibble: 128 × 6
   origin dest  worst_arrival worst_airline            best_arrival best_airline
   <chr>  <chr>         <dbl> <chr>                           <dbl> <chr>       
 1 EWR    ATL           19.5  ExpressJet Airlines Inc.       -6.25  Endeavor Ai…
 2 EWR    AUS            4.28 United Air Lines Inc.         -11.2   Southwest A…
 3 EWR    BDL           22.6  United Air Lines Inc.           6.78  ExpressJet …
 4 EWR    BNA           17.7  ExpressJet Airlines Inc.       -2.13  Southwest A…
 5 EWR    BOS            6.87 JetBlue Airways                -4.01  ExpressJet …
 6 EWR    BWI           20.1  ExpressJet Airlines Inc.        5.95  Southwest A…
 7 EWR    CHS           16.2  ExpressJet Airlines Inc.      -14     United Air …
 8 EWR    CLE            5.97 United Air Lines Inc.          -3.71  ExpressJet …
 9 EWR    CLT           20.5  ExpressJet Airlines Inc.        0.920 US Airways …
10 EWR    CVG           21.2  ExpressJet Airlines Inc.        1.40  Endeavor Ai…
# ℹ 118 more rows

#group_vars(Q3)

Q4 = Q3 %>%
  mutate(diff = worst_arrival - best_arrival) %>% 
  arrange(desc(diff)) %>% 
  slice(1)
Q4

# A tibble: 1 × 7
  origin dest  worst_arrival worst_airline       best_arrival best_airline  diff
  <chr>  <chr>         <dbl> <chr>                      <dbl> <chr>        <dbl>
1 JFK    ATL             128 ExpressJet Airline…         1.40 Endeavor Ai…  127.

Q5 = flights %>% 
  left_join(airlines, by = "carrier") %>% 
  filter(origin == "JFK", dest == "ATL", name == "ExpressJet Airlines Inc.") 
Q5

# A tibble: 1 × 20
   year month   day dep_time sched_dep_time dep_delay arr_time sched_arr_time
  <int> <int> <int>    <int>          <int>     <dbl>    <int>          <int>
1  2013    10     7      904            700       124     1133            925
# ℹ 12 more variables: arr_delay <dbl>, carrier <chr>, flight <int>,
#   tailnum <chr>, origin <chr>, dest <chr>, air_time <dbl>, distance <dbl>,
#   hour <dbl>, minute <dbl>, time_hour <dttm>, name <chr>


The explaination for 6.5 is basically because it has the highest absolute difference. ExpressJet only ever does this route once (as shown above) and it had a huge delay and thus there is no way of pulling down the delay time as it is a single value. Therefore the law of averages cannot pull down the large delay. So when comparing it to the flight on this route with the best mean itll create a large difference.

                          54510L, 91326L, 78611L, 31402L, 29586L, 21441L, 58269L, 84173L, 
                          88295L, 37940L, 43750L, 69750L, 92356L, 82518L, 91455L, 68866L, 
                          51178L, 68275L, 27689L, 35418L, 81318L, 62405L, 86851L, 25654L, 
                          47553L, 74474L, 51409L, 22607L, 55360L, 96351L, 21516L, 41927L, 
                          55810L), 
               education = c("master", "bachelor", "PhD", "master", 
                             "bachelor", "highschool", "PhD", "highschool", "PhD", "PhD", 
                             "bachelor", "highschool", "master", "bachelor", "PhD", "PhD", 
                             "PhD", "bachelor", "master", "highschool", "PhD", "highschool", 
                             "bachelor", "master", "highschool", "highschool", "master", 
                             "master", "bachelor", "PhD", "highschool", "PhD", "master", 
                             "master", "master", "PhD", "highschool", "master", "master", 
                             "highschool", "bachelor", "highschool", "bachelor", "PhD", 
                             "bachelor", "highschool", "master", "highschool", "bachelor", 
                             "bachelor"), 
               region = c("North", "South", "North", "West", 
                         "North", "West", "South", "South", "West", "South", "West", 
                         "South", "West", "East", "North", "West", "North", "North", 
                         "West", "North", "East", "West", "South", "North", "North", 
                         "East", "East", "North", "North", "West", "South", "West", 
                         "West", "East", "West", "North", "West", "North", "East", 
                         "North", "West", "South", "South", "East", "North", "West", 
                         "West", "East", "North", "East"), 
               marital_status = c("divorced", 
                                  "single", "divorced", "divorced", "divorced", "divorced", 
                                  "divorced", "married", "divorced", "married", "divorced", 
                                  "widowed", "married", "single", "widowed", "widowed", "single", 
                                  "divorced", "widowed", "widowed", "single", "married", "single", 
                                  "married", "widowed", "married", "single", "single", "widowed", 
                                  "married", "widowed", "divorced", "single", "married", "single", 
                                  "widowed", "widowed", "married", "widowed", "divorced", "married", 
                                  "married", "divorced", "single", "married", "widowed", "divorced", 
                                  "divorced", "single", "divorced")), 
          row.names = c(NA, -50L
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
                        ), 
          class = c("tbl_df", "tbl", "data.frame"))
#N/As
#Nulls = dat %>% filter(if_any(everything(), is.na))
Nulls = dat %>% 
  mutate(rowNum = row_number()) %>% 
  filter(if_any(everything(), is.na))
# First check to see where inconsistencies are
# dat %>% count(gender) check individual
# Check all in freq table:
irreg = dat %>%
  select(gender, disease_status, education, smoker, exercise, region, marital_status) %>% 
  pivot_longer(everything(), names_to = "vars", values_to = "vals") %>% 
  count(vars, vals)
  # Now I know that disease_status and gender have mispellings
genderErr = dat %>% 
  mutate(rowNum = row_number()) %>% 
  filter(gender == "femal")

diseaseErr = dat %>% 
  mutate(rowNum = row_number()) %>% 
  filter(disease_status == "Healthy")

Q7 = bind_rows(Nulls, genderErr, diseaseErr)
Q7

7 id_10    56 female   165.   67.7 AB         Healthy                196      80
